DataElement.preferredName: Head and Neck Pharynx Superior Constrictor Muscle Extend Present Yes No Unknown Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/unknown indicator related to the extension of the tumor into the superior pharyngeal constrictor muscle.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Head and Neck Pharynx Superior Constrictor Muscle Extend Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the pharynx and extension of the tumor into the superior constrictor muscle.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: For oncology, area of the body generally construed to comprise base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas.

Concepts.definition: For oncology, an area of the body generally construed to comprise the base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas.

Property.preferredName: Pharynx Superior Constrictor Muscle Extend Present
Property.preferredDefinition: (FAIR-inks) The hollow tube about 5 inches long that starts behind the nose and ends at the top of the trachea (windpipe) and esophagus (the tube that goes to the stomach).:The uppermost of the three constrictor muscles of the pharynx.  It receives nerve supply from the pharyngeal plexus.:To increase in length or duration.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: A hollow tube that starts posterior to the mouth and nasal cavity and ends superior to the trachea and esophagus.
The uppermost of the three constrictor muscles of the pharynx.  It receives nerve supply from the pharyngeal plexus.
To increase in length or duration.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.
